name: Super F1 Circus 3
overview: As with its predecessors, it has licenses from FOCA (the Formula One Constructors Association) and Fuji TV (the TV station that covers F1 in Japan) that allow it to depict actual teams/drivers from the Formula One World Championship. The circuits include: Interlagos (Brazil) (presently known as Autodromo Jose Carlos Pace) TI Circuit Aida (Japan) (presently known as Okayama International Circuit) Imora (San Marino) (presently known as Autodromo Internazionale Enzo e Dino Ferrari) Monte Carlo (Monaco) Catalunya (Spain) Montreal (Canada) (actually the Circuit Gilles Villeneuve) Magny Cours (France) Silverstone (United Kingdom) Hockenheim (Germany) Hungaroring (Hungary) Spa Francorchamps (Belgium) Monza (Italy) Estoril (Portugal) Buenos Aires (Argentina) Suzuka (Japan) Adelaide (Australia)
